title: Building a Modern PT Lab with Generative AI

steps.title: Setting Up Virtual Environments
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Install Kali Linux in a VM, configure networking, and set up target machines like Metasploitable. Use GenAI to generate setup scripts.

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Proper resource allocation for VMs
- Secure network isolation between lab segments
- Successful Kali Linux installation and updates
- Target machine vulnerabilities and services
- AI tool integration capabilities

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Install virtualization software (VirtualBox, VMware, KVM)
2. Download Kali Linux ISO
3. Create VM with appropriate resources (4GB RAM, 50GB disk)
4. Install Kali Linux with default settings
5. Configure networking (NAT for internet, Host-only for lab isolation)

TARGET MACHINES:
- Metasploitable 2/3 for vulnerable targets
- Windows Server for AD testing
- Ubuntu/Debian for web app testing
- Configure isolated network segment

AI-ASSISTED SETUP:
Use Shell GPT to generate VM configuration scripts and network setup commands.

steps.title: Integrating GenAI Tools
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Install and configure Shell GPT and Ollama for AI-assisted command generation. Test basic prompts for lab automation.

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Successful installation of AI tools
- Proper API key configuration
- Model availability and performance
- Command generation accuracy
- Integration with existing tools

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Install Shell GPT using pip
2. Install Ollama and download models
3. Configure API keys and test connections
4. Generate basic pentesting commands
5. Test integration with lab environment

INSTALLING SHELL GPT:
```bash
pip install shell-gpt
sgpt --help
```

INSTALLING OLLAMA:
```bash
curl -fsSL https://ollama.ai/install.sh | sh
ollama pull llama2
ollama serve
```

CONFIGURATION:
- Set up API keys for OpenAI (if using ChatGPT)
- Configure local Ollama models
- Test basic prompts for pentesting commands

INTEGRATION TESTING:
Generate commands for Nmap scanning and analyze outputs.

steps.title: AI-Driven Lab Exercises
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Perform reconnaissance on lab targets using AI-generated scripts. Analyze outputs and iterate with GenAI for optimization.

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Accuracy of AI-generated commands
- Effectiveness of AI-assisted analysis
- Learning opportunities from AI suggestions
- Integration between AI tools and manual techniques
- Iterative improvement through AI feedback

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Use AI to generate reconnaissance commands
2. Execute on target VMs
3. Analyze results with AI assistance
4. Iterate and refine approach

PRACTICAL SCENARIOS:
- Port scanning with Nmap
- Service enumeration
- Vulnerability identification
- Basic exploitation attempts

AI OPTIMIZATION:
Ask GenAI to suggest improvements to scanning techniques and interpret results.
